item.title: Deduction Boardgames (Part 1; Passive)
item.description: The past couple of years, more and more “logic deduction boardgames” have appeared. Most of them are very simple, yet have become wildly successful and popular.

item.title: Pirate Drawingbeard
item.description:
This is a devlog for my game “Pirate Drawingbeard”

It’s kind of a “prequel” to my game “Pirate Riddlebeard”.

item.title: Pirate Riddlebeard
item.description:
This is a devlog for my game “Pirate Riddlebeard”

A large chunk of the work in this game went into writing the algorithm that generates the games. I wrote a separate article about that: Deduction Boardgames (link will appear when the article is done)

item.title: One Paper Games: 2022 Update
item.description: Two years ago now, I started creating something I called “One Paper Games”. I created a handful of them, experimenting with all sorts of fun ways to play games, and am very proud of the results.

item.title: A Recipe For Disaster
item.description: Last week, I created A Recipe For Disaster. A couch co-op game for 1-4 players, for literally all ages and skill levels, about running a bakery.

item.title: Why I created "The Peerful Project"
item.description:
If you don’t know about the project yet, visit the official page: The Peerful Project—Free Local Multiplayer Games

I also wrote an in-depth article series about How I Created “Pizza Peers”. It covers many of the same topics and ideas, and actually shares the code I used, in case you want to create your own games like these.

item.title: Print and Play Games!
item.description:
It’s finally here!

I have completed and uploaded my official page full of free boardgames: Print & Play Boardgames
